intro: Mikania loretensis, commonly known as the Loretto Mikania, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the Caribbean. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine with opposite, heart-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Mikania loretensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
